diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Superimposed pneumonia, other specified disorders of gallbladder
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with acute onset right upper quadrant pain, nausea, vomiting, fever, and had a diagnosis of acute cholecystitis confirmed by associated abdominal symptoms and diagnostic imaging. Consideration of pneumonia was noted due to findings of increased opacification at the lung bases and absent pneumothorax, suggesting potential respiratory involvement.
